stories.text:
Please state the location and include REMOTE, INTERNS and/or VISA when that sort of candidate is welcome. When remote work is not an option, include ONSITE.

Please only post if you personally are part of the hiring company—no recruiting firms or job boards. Only one post per company. If it isn't a household name, please explain what your company does.

Commenters: please don't reply to job posts to complain about something. It's off topic here.

Readers: please only email if you are personally interested in the job.

Searchers: try https://kennytilton.github.io/whoishiring/, https://hnjobs.emilburzo.com, https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=10313519.

Don't miss these other fine threads:

Who wants to be hired? https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=31947295

Freelancer? Seeking freelancer? https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=31947296
stories.title: Ask HN: Who is hiring? (July 2022)

stories.text:
Please lead with either SEEKING WORK or SEEKING FREELANCER, your location, and whether remote work is a possibility.

Bonsai (YC W16) (https://www.hellobonsai.com) offers freelance contracts, proposals, invoices, etc.
stories.title: Ask HN: Freelancer? Seeking freelancer? (July 2022)

stories.text:
Share your information if you are looking for work. Please use this format:

  Location:
  Remote:
  Willing to relocate:
  Technologies:
  Résumé/CV:
  Email:
Readers: please only email these addresses to discuss work opportunities.

Searchers: try https://seisvelas.github.io/hn-candidates-search/ or https://hirehackernews.com/.
stories.title: Ask HN: Who wants to be hired? (July 2022)

stories.text:
Hi,

I am an engineer by day, IndieHacker by night. I have been very interested in real estate and the powers and freedom it can provide, specifically cash flow rentals.

By looking through deals I have found that deal finding can be very redundant and manual. Basically taking the numbers such as financing, hoa fees, accounting for capex and maintenance, property taxes etc. You build your monthly total for expenses and find out comparable rent through a tool like Rentometer. I use BiggerPockets calculator to calculate expenses and it generates a nice report showing cashflow, home equity etc.

There is no reason why I can't know all of these numbers instantly when I click on a Zillow listing. That is why I am building homescope.io, a tool to show you how much a rental can cashflow the second you click on a Zillow listing.

If you have neat tools that help you find and calculate real estate deals, please share!
stories.title: Automating Real Estate Investing: Estimate the monthly cashflow for a property
